0.text:
I suppose you could say I'm lucky.
I've lived my whole life here in Wales, under

4.text:
a Welsh Labour government.
Of course things are not always perfect.

9.text:
There are always tough decisions to be made,
especially with the Tories in London cutting

13.text:
the money Wales gets.
But I've always felt that the government here

17.text:
has been on my side. They want to do the right
thing by the people here.

22.text:
But it's not always been like that.
Although they want you to forget it now, I'll

27.text:
never forgive the Tories for what they done
to my family, friends and my community.

33.text:
You know it makes my blood boil watching the
Tories on TV glossing over the terrible things

37.text:
they've done to Wales.
Back in the 80s they pushed communities like

44.text:
mine over the edge.
Put thousands on the dole and said it was

47.text:
a price worth paying.
We can't let them do they same thing again.

52.text:
And in this election, a vote for anyone but
Welsh Labour helps the Tories win. It's that

57.text:
simple.
We used to vote Plaid Cymru, even campaigned

61.text:
for them but not anymore.
They claim to hate the Tories but Plaid Cymru

65.text:
has already tried to put them into government
here in Wales.

68.text:
Our country can't afford another five years
of a UK Tory government. They ran our country

73.text:
and our communities into the ground the last
time they were in power.

80.text:
Because the very things I love about this
country are the things the Tories did their

84.text:
level best to destroy.
The community, the compassion, the fierce

88.text:
belief in social justice that welcomed me
when I moved here and it made me want to give

93.text:
something back to the country that has given
me so much.

97.text:
That's why I stood to be a Welsh Labour councillor.
I was proud to be elected on these values.

102.text:
These Welsh Labour values that say no matter
who you are or where you come from you have

107.text:
stake in our country and you have a contribution
to make.

111.text:
The Tories said there's no such thing as society.
Well here in Wales we know that simply isn't

117.text:
true.
Growing up in the 1980s I remember all too

120.text:
well the Tory onslaught on Wales.
Now today, I'm proud to serve alongside my

125.text:
Welsh Labour colleagues here in our National
Assembly where we are once again doing our

129.text:
best to stand up for Wales.
And despite the UK Conservative Government

133.text:
slashing our budget by over one billion pounds
we're determined to put our Welsh Labour values

137.text:
into practice.
That means building new schools and transforming

141.text:
our communities while keeping the Tory grammar
schools out of Wales.

145.text:
It means putting millions more into social
care to give our pensioners the dignity they

149.text:
deserve whilst avoiding the social care crisis
happening under the Tories in England.

153.text:
But we're doing all of this under the shadow
of a ruthless UK Conservative Government.

157.text:
With Labour in power in Westminster, we could
do so much more.

162.text:
And we did.
I was proud to serve in a Labour Government

165.text:
that delivered for Wales.
It delivered devolution. It delivered record

169.text:
numbers of police on our streets and record
levels of funding for the people of Wales.

175.text:
That Labour Government delivered the National
Minimum Wage, increased protection for workers,

180.text:
the New Deal for the unemployed, pension credits,
invested in our manufacturing industries,

187.text:
outlawed fox hunting, signed the Kyoto Protocol
on climate change and helped deliver lasting

194.text:
peace in Northern Ireland.
This is what you can achieve in power.

199.text:
This is why we need a strong team of Welsh
Labour MPs back in Parliament, fighting for

204.text:
their communities and delivering for Wales.
And in recent weeks, I've been out campaigning

211.text:
and meeting people the length and breadth
of Wales.

215.text:
I've seen the difference Welsh Labour are
making in government but I've also heard first

220.text:
hand just what the risks are if the Tories
get back in.

223.text:
And I just won't let that happen.
I got into politics through my anger at what

227.text:
the Tories did to Wales a generation ago.
We thought we were done with that kind of

232.text:
politics, done with the neglect of our public
services that meant record waiting lists in

236.text:
hospitals and crumbling schools.
Done with gutting whole industries like mining

242.text:
and steel and leaving communities without
hope.

245.text:
Make no mistake, that bleak threat still continues
to haunt us.

248.text:
We simply can't afford five more years of
Tory cuts, indifference and cruelty.

254.text:
Welsh Labour is delivering.
Delivering the best GCSE results. A Living

257.text:
Wage in the NHS. Record employment.
But all this is at risk if the Tories trample

262.text:
all over Wales again.
So we need your support more now than ever

267.text:
to fight the Tory cuts and together to stand
up for Wales.
